*div1 type="summary"* *p*William Bloodgood to Austin, April 4. 1827. Land troubles.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="04-04-1827">April 4th—1827*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Please to settle the dispute between myself and *person_mentioned*E. Brinson*/person_mentioned* about a piece of *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*bought of said *person_mentioned*Brinson */person_mentioned*by me for 25 cents per acre this being while the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*was absent a bond was drawn for the same [by] *person_mentioned*Daniel E Bailes*/person_mentioned* calling for *location_mentioned*six square acres front runing parallel with the uper lint of *person_mentioned*Brinson*/person_mentioned*s league to the back line*/location_mentioned* Now said *person_mentioned*Brinson */person_mentioned*refuses to give a deed for acres but has surveyed a like quantity of arpents for me which I refuse to receive—*/p*
*p*He also wishes to alter his lines so as to make his league narrower and longer which will be prejudicial to my purchase—Now sir you will oblige me if you will assure me if a man contracts for acres if he can be compelled to take arpents—this will perhaps save me some trouble I am poor and do not wish to incur Expences But dont wish to be wronged—*/p*
*p*I further wish to trouble you with the Examination of a receipt for the payment of another piece of *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*purchased of the same man which also specifies acres and remains unsettled which is here inclosed please send the receipt to me by *person_mentioned*Mr- Hunter*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Wm Bloodgood*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
